alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cooper City, or over Pembroke Pines, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Miami Gardens, Weston, North Miami, Doral, North Miami Beach, Miami Lakes, Cooper City, Hialeah Gardens, Opa-Locka, West Park, Miami Springs and Miami Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
